snippet: A granddaughter of the couple that founded the Trinity Broadcasting Network has gone public with accusations of financial impropriety and excess, which TBN denies.
abstract: Family battle for control of the Trinity Broadcasting Network, the world's largest Christian television network, offers a glimpse into the lavish lifestyles enjoyed by some employees at the organization; Brittany Koper, granddaughter of founders Paul and Janice Crouch, has gone public with accusations of financial impropriety; TBN says Koper and her husband made charges only after the company confronted them with evidence of embezzlement.

byline.contributor: Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: A granddaughter of the couple that founded the Trinity Broadcasting Network has gone public with accusations of financial impropriety and excess, which TBN denies.
